title: All-new Specialized Levo 4 eMTB Boast up to 111Nm of Super Power, Control & Genie Adjustability
content:
The all-new carbon Specialized Levo 4 eMTB boosts power, range, control, ride & geometry adjustability, and even how much integrated SWAT gear you can carry on your rides. Basically, every stat on this ebike gets big improvements over the already popular previous generation, as Specialized aims to build the ultimate enduro-ready all-mountain eMTB. They describe it as the culmination of “where super power meets natural… you only faster.”

2025 Specialized Levo 4 carbon all-mountain eMTB

Specialized describes their new 150mm travel Levo 4 e-mountainbike with a lot of “super” superlatives. And forgive me for carrying on some of their super marketing speak. But the new Levo is clearly one of the best eMTBs on the market. Its only real downside, unsurprisingly, is the eye-watering pricetag.

If you can suspend your disbelief of the $13.5k price for a few minutes, it is interesting to dig into a lot of great new tech. With the Levo 4, Specialized managed to make a more powerful ebike that is also more controllable, has a natural riding feel (for the most part), and is quiet enough to not detract from your ride enjoying the great outdoors.

Super Power

At the core of the new 4th generation Levo is one of two all-new 3.1 series motors – both featuring class-leading power, smoother power delivery, and much quieter operation. And 27% more power than the gen 3 Levo.

The new S-Works-only motor now boasts 111Nm of torque and 720W peak power, while the standard model still puts out 101Nm and up to 666W of peak power.

Battery options also go big. Most ebikes will come with a 840Wh internal battery, but there’s also a lighter 600Wh option if you want to go superlight. Add the 280Wh external range extender battery to boost either’s range. Or run the range extender only, and it transforms the new Levo into a light-assist eMTB to ride with friends on low-powered ebikes, too.

Super Natural Control

But with more power comes more… need for control. And that’s where smarter firmware comes in. Specialized reworked power delivery to enable smoother transitions to all of that extra torque, repeatedly testing their control systems on loose climbs to dial it in perfectly. At the same time, the new motors do a better job of continuing to match & boost your power, especially as your cadence increases. 60rpm was the sweet spot before, but now the gen 3.1 motors keep up the power to peak around 70rpm. But it now stays consistent all the way up to 120rpm, so you can keep spinning faster on those toughest climbs without worrying about upshifting and losing grip or support.

Quieter Running

More ‘super power’ and more ‘super natural’ smoothness are both great. But now, thanks to new hard diamond-like coatings to the steel gears inside, the meshing of the internal gears inside the new motors is quieter.

Then, new ‘potting’ (an insulator material around the electric motor’s stators) means you get less of the wind-up noise of the motor as well.

Add one more fact that the main motor bearing is now physically decoupled from the metal motor housing, and that noise simply doesn’t get amplified out of the motor. The result is a much quieter operation. We’ve ridden this thing next to the latest Shimano, Bosch & Pinion ebikes and

2025 Specialized Levo 4 – Pricing, options & availability

Four complete builds are available of the new Specialized Levo 4 eMTB all sharing the same carbon frame, plus a frameset for real custom builds.

The three lowest specs all share the slightly lower-powered 101Nm/666W peak motor, starting at $8000 for the Levo 4 Comp Carbon, $9500 for the Levo 4 Expert, and $11,500 for the Levo 4 Pro.

Then, you can get the top-spec S-Works Levo 4 complete with the 111Nm/720W motor for a whopping $13,500 (surprisingly less than a top-tier S-Works road or XC race bike.) But if you want something especially unique, you can pick up a $7500 S-Works frameset, including the most powerful ebike powertrain, and build your own superlight or ultra-fancy build.

Get yours from your local Specialized dealer now.
